page.title: 12ST.LEONARD'S CHURCH, BENGEO
page.content: St.Leonard's is a simple{Norman church with 3ft thick flint and plaster walls and an 18th century red brick porch. A {medieval wall painting}has been found. Services,from Whit Sunday,alternate each week between Holy Communion, 8.00 and Evensong,18.00.In{winter}it is too cold for services but a special one is held on St.Leonard's day,November 6th. In 1985{The Friends of St.Leonard's {Church}was set up a) to maintain and improve the fabric of the church and b) to pray, especially for people held captive for expressing their religious or political beliefs. (St.Leonard is the patron saint of prisoners). Their first project is to embroider {100 kneelers,}to add something of the 20th century.Each will cost Â£10,either given by the embroiderer or a donator. A local furniture shop will cover the kneelers, hopefully by June 1986.
